tweet: My office is here to serve #TX32, and we couldn’t do that without the help of our interns and fellows. I want to thank those who served in both my Richardson and DC offices. No child in our North Texas community should have to skip a meal and go hungry. In Texas, more than 79% of SNAP participants are families with children. This proposal will harm those families and prevent children from getting the help they need. http://ow.ly/R5uB50vMXCX

#OTD 56 years ago, thousands of Americans gathered at the National Mall, marching together for civil & economic freedom. Their peaceful assembly, inspiring our nation and world, was narrated by MLK's dreams of equality for all. We continue that work to make those dreams reality. pic.twitter.com/Hah1QP5cID

Whether it is lowering health care costs or investing in infrastructure, to deliver real results for North Texans, we must work together to accomplish our goals. I will always fight for North Texas values and work to get things done for #TX32.  http://ow.ly/2A9e50vK62W

Today we celebrate #WomensEqualityDay in honor of the suffragettes and other trailblazers who fought for the right to vote as full and equal citizens. I am proud to stand alongside the women who continue to pave the way for future generations. pic.twitter.com/8sePHFb60H

Over the August work period, I’ve traveled across #TX32 to hear from you on the issues that matter to North Texans. As someone who was born and raised in this district, I will always put North Texans first. Watch my update and sign up for my newsletter:  https://allred.house.gov/contact/newsletter … pic.twitter.com/MCqu8QzHYp

A VA clinic in Garland would be a win-win for veterans and our region. That’s why I’m leading with a bipartisan group of my North Texas colleagues to bring a VA health facility to Garland. 

We must work together to ensure North Texas veterans can get the health care they need. https://twitter.com/dallasnews/status/1165687031332311041 …

Dean Foods is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the country, and their HQ is here in #TX32. Thanks to folks who shared their thoughts at our employee town hall. It's important I hear from you on how we can work together to ensure North Texas continues to thrive. pic.twitter.com/5mG5Xqe7Qy

I want to wish all of the students, parents and faculty in #TX32 a great start to the school year! Education opened so many doors for me, and I know with a little bit of hard work and the right kind of support, every student can chase their version of the American dream. pic.twitter.com/MNQDQGK5mx

I was glad to join the bipartisan @DRC forum with @RepEBJ, @RepVanTaylor and @RepVeasey yesterday to discuss trade, infrastructure and how we can work together on the many issues impacting our North Texas community. pic.twitter.com/ZkVF5QpLij

As a new father, I know how critical it is that new parents and babies get the care and resources they need. I thank @RepVeasey for leading this effort and I look forward to working in a bipartisan way to address the infant and maternal mortality crisis.  https://twitter.com/RepVeasey/status/1164640491952103435 … pic.twitter.com/kqKWwk2QK3

It was great to join my colleague @RepVanTaylor today for a forum at the @RichardsonCoC to discuss the many issues our businesses are facing, and how we can work together to ensure North Texas continues to be a place where our businesses thrive and succeed. #TX32 pic.twitter.com/mvDUBdgJfH

David & Patti Mitchell founded Mitchell Enterprises 30 years ago in a spare room in their home, and have grown into a successful HVAC business. Thanks to all who shared stories at our roundtable @veteranwomensec. This week, a number of my colleagues and I called on the Senate to immediately take up the bills we've passed to reduce gun violence and for the applicable House committees to begin working on legislation to address this rising tide of racist domestic terrorism. 2/2

Like many North Texans, I've spent the last few days processing the act of domestic terrorism that took the lives of so many fellow Texans in El Paso, and how a North Texan could’ve committed such an atrocity. 

I'm again urging Congress to act.  https://www.cbsnews.com/news/house-members-urge-congressional-leaders-to-call-session-to-address-white-supremacy/ … 1/2

#PurpleHeartDay honors our incredible service members who were wounded on the battlefield or gave the ultimate sacrifice of their lives for our freedoms. As a member of the @VetAffairsDems, I will always be grateful for the courage of our men and women in uniform. pic.twitter.com/0FoIjVl3fZ

I was born and raised in #TX32, so it’s no surprise to me that North Texas is home to some of the most hardworking people in the country. Dallas and Garland made the top ten cities in Texas and in the US! http://ow.ly/YMRn50vq2Do

My story would not be possible without the Voting Rights Act. As a voting rights attorney, I know we have come a long way, but we still have more work to do to ensure everyone has equal and uninhibited access to the ballot box.

It has been 54 years since the landmark Voting Rights Act was signed into law, helping to ensure that no matter who you are or where you live, every citizen can participate in our American democracy. pic.twitter.com/4tf5ytkpwf
